alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Slow moving storms have begun to train over northern Anne Arundel County. Localized flooding is possible... ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Maryland, including the following county: Anne Arundel. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 329 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Severn... Riviera Beach... Baltimore-Washington Airport... Glen Burnie... Severna Park... Odenton... Pasadena... Lake Shore... Ferndale... Fort Meade... South Gate... Green Haven... Linthicum... Gambrills... Harmans... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
